result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruby G McMiller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
No fine.
Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) no later than 3-15-2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for  242 days, TIME SERVED.
Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruby G McMiller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ruby G McMiller in court with Attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Ruby G McMiller in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe, appearing for Michael Lonski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve  120  DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for  242 days; TIME SERVED.
- No fine
- Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) no later than 3-15-2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Ruby G McMiller not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled for sentencing.  Parties have been informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, in Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Ruby G McMiller not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to time constraints, matter adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter adjourned for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing memorandum received and filed

Defendant Ruby G McMiller in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Ruby G McMiller in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court ordered the remand withdrawn and sets bail at $500.00 cash.

Defendant Ruby G McMiller in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Ruby G McMiller not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter adjourned for projected guilty plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Ruby G McMiller not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment of the currently scheduled Plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Ruby G McMiller not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant withdraws her special plea.  Matter scheduled for projected guilty plea  Plea hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps via telephone, defendant Ruby G McMiller not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney has a brief he has to get done by the end of business today on another matter and requests this matter be adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, Defendant Ruby G McMiller not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense in trial.  Status conference scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Ruby G McMiller not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Defense also wants to check into the possibility of the Public Defenders office's willingness to have their own examination done at the Public Defenders expense.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Ruby G McMiller not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for hearing on the doctor's report.  However, Branch 21 is in jury trial and the matter needs to be adjourned. Parties did not request a spin.  Defense counsel requested a return on doctor's report date on 07/13/2015 as the defendant has a court date in Branch 07 on that day as well. Defense counsel said that video conferencing is NOT needed for the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Competency report by Courtney Endres PsyD received and filed.
Letter from Courtney Endres PsyD received and filed.
Competency report dated 6/25/2015 received and filed.
Addendum to previously subitted evaluation received and filed.
by PsyD Courtney Endres received and filed.
Letter form Winnebago Mental Health Institute requesting an extension received and filed.

Defendant Ruby G McMiller in court via video conference with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Ruby G McMiller in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Proceedings held via video conference. Case in court for return on doctor's report.  A letter was submitted prior by the doctor requesting an extension as collateral records are not yet available. Parties don't contest the extension, and an extension was granted by the Court. Video conference is not available until 07/07/2015. Defense to work with the Court presiding over case #14CF3819 to have the report submitted in this case, to be submitted on the aforementioned case as well. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Report from Dr. Courtney Endres received and filed with court.
Order for Com,petency Examination by Department of Health Services signed and filed.  Copies given to Sheriff's department, Defense counsel and State.

Defendant Ruby G McMiller in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Ruby G McMiller in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant accepts findings of Dr. Pankiewicz, who is unable provide an opinion and recommends defendant be remanded for an inpatient assessment of her competency.    Court ordered defendant remanded to DHS for an inpatient evaluation.   Report due 6/18/15.   Defendant to appear via video on the next court date. Video technican notified.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed.

Defendant Ruby G McMiller in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Ruby G McMiller in custody.  Jeremy Arn for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ruby G McMiller in court with attorney Steve Sargent for Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Ruby G McMiller in custody.  Irene Parthum for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is requesting an adjournment, Correctional Officer is not available for today's proceedings.  Defense does not object to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ruby G McMiller in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ruby G McMiller in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
